item.title: 255 – Peaches
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Peaches Neighbor Kate once wrote a poem about the slim V of skin found at the neck in a sweater and how peaches tinned in syrup have a way of sliding down the throat, so cool. It was a poem … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Peaches

Neighbor Kate
once wrote
a poem about
the slim V
of skin found
at the neck
in a sweater
and how peaches
tinned in syrup
have a way
of sliding down
the throat, so cool.

It was a poem
about so much
more than peaches
or skin, about
the chill that comes
with both.

I see her pass by
in the evening
with her dog, as if
no magic trailed her.
We wave and say
hello and ask after
the other and the world
we each keep stays
our own.

Lost on the porch
with the crickets
and moths battering
the late light of summer
I watch the neighbor
-hood fall into relief.
I can still taste
those peaches, so cool
and so sweet.

item.title: 254 – The Face I Make
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: The Face I Make Today I learned the face I make at slow tragedy. When Maesie said MS I said, what does that mean? I might have it, she said. And I said, No, what does MS mean, which one … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
The Face I Make

Today I learned the face
I make at slow tragedy.
When Maesie said MS
I said, what does that mean?
I might have it, she said.
And I said, No,
what does MS mean, which one
of the diseases is that?
She told me, waving
a half-eaten butter cookie
crumbs flaking off like her nerves
might soon do. I watched her face
react to the face I made. Stop it
she said. People keep doing that.
Doing what, I said. That, she said.
That aww face, like you’re crushed,
like you’re the one with MS.
I tried to make my face something other
than what it was, brave maybe, instead
of the sad, bent shape it had, but lips are lips
and so what to do? The butter cookie
was mostly gone by then, scattered into our laps.
We hugged on the corner in the sun.
Days later I’m still finding crumbs
in my clothes, a greasy feeling on my hands.

item.title: 253 – Trimming Zinnias
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Trimming Zinnias We watch her on the sly across the room around the edges of conversations sitting in front of us from the thing that happened at work, the dog dying, the bad argument, that Caleb is finally crawling, my … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Trimming Zinnias

We watch her on the sly
across the room
around the edges of conversations
sitting in front of us

from the thing that happened at work,
the dog dying, the bad argument,
that Caleb is finally crawling, my God,
can you believe it?

to her slight frame
in a sheer white smock
pushed up at the elbows,
the precise clip of the shears

trimming zinnias–orange,
purple, a spray of white
angle’s breath listing
in the too-big vase

the water in the vase
bending
back the light
at an unfamiliar angle

the flowers clump together
as if afraid
their leaves sigh
in a slight breeze

with a shake, as if she’s done this
a thousand times, every day
of her life, they tumble
apart, the individual bells

of the heads looking out
into the room, past each other,
as we are, standing on their own
the stems tangled together

item.title: 252 – This Is Just To Say
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: This Is Just To Say I did not eat the plums hiding in the paper sack which you saved two days for my breakfast Forgive me I left them too long so sweet and so rotten
item.content:encoded:
This Is Just To Say

I did not eat
the plums
hiding
in the paper sack

which you saved
two days
for my breakfast
Forgive me

I left them
too long
so sweet
and so rotten

item.title: 251- Transubstantiation
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Transubstantiation There is no face in the bowl of salt only a well my fingers made salting the delicata squash last night thyme rosemary pepper I kept my face in the oven blast of scent and steam stirring the delicate … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Transubstantiation

There is no face
in the bowl of salt
only a well
my fingers made
salting the delicata
squash last night

thyme rosemary pepper
I kept my face
in the oven blast of scent
and steam stirring
the delicate smiles

I am so often caught
looking for faces

I will dress the potato
Iâ€™m baking for lunch
chives pepper
more salt
pray over its halved body
as is my ritual

hoping to take in more
than skin and flesh
hoping to taste more
than salt and earth

item.title: 250 – a list of incomprehensibles
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: a list of incomprehensibles ironing board latches pantyhose spaghetti squash dog toes lady habits mens/womens pant sizing king james most knots denominations (religious) addictions the joy of certain smells shoe architecture expensive haircuts platypi string theory the world in my … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
a list of incomprehensibles

ironing board latches
pantyhose
spaghetti squash
dog toes
lady habits
mens/womens pant sizing
king james
most knots
denominations (religious)
addictions
the joy of certain smells
shoe architecture
expensive haircuts
platypi
string theory
the world in my cat’s head
daily choices
poemtry

item.title: 249 – Seven Days
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Seven Days Language isn’t worth much tonight. Job had it right: sit in your ashes in silence. Speaking only fucks it up.
item.content:encoded:
Seven Days

Language isn’t worth much tonight.

Job had it right: sit

in your ashes in silence.

Speaking only fucks it up.

item.title: 248 – crepitus
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: crepitus is the sound of the body rebelling specific: when bone meets bone (the same) like what Adam said to Eve at the first sunset outside Eden when shit got real for the first time darkness was full of eyes … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
crepitus

is the sound
of the body rebelling
specific: when bone meets bone
(the same)

like what Adam said
to Eve at the first sunset
outside Eden
when shit got real

for the first time
darkness was full
of eyes not theirs
& fear crept in like a snake

spent all day digging
up roots, confused
by bruised palms, aching
arms, and her belly

what a way to begin
a life together
for the second time
against a rock

and nothing more
makes you wonder: how
did the first people ever learn
to worship?

(crepitus: look it up.)

item.title: 247 – thinks i can’t unthink
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: thinks i can’t unthink when i wake at two a.m. from the living coma i put myself in again you are not dead or raped or missing or you are alive you are breathing you are next to me your … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
thinks i can’t unthink

when i wake
at two a.m.
from the living
coma
i put myself
in again
you are not
dead or
raped or
missing or
you are
alive you are
breathing you are
next to me
your warm hand
curled in nothing
but sleep
but I am
awake
wrapped up
in all the dark
thinks i can’t unthink
no matter
how hard i try
no matter how
much i want
your hand to be
the only thing
that is that matters
no matter
no matter

item.title: 246 – covenant
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: covenant the hole open where once a stone tablet broken cast down the mtn the pieces make an altar to burn to shelter to stand & cast a shadow # rain fills the empty nest a lake a mirror stretch … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
covenant

the hole open
where once
a stone

tablet
broken

cast down
the mtn

the pieces make
an altar

to burn
to shelter
to stand & cast
a shadow

#

rain fills the empty
nest

a lake a mirror

stretch your hand out
over

the surface: only your hand
turned back

on itself
grasping

nothing
but itself
